title: Convex mirror set - compare h-i for points P and Q

content.description: An object is placed in front of a convex mirror, as shown in the figure. The object is initially located at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mtext>P</mtext></math>. A second point, Point <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mtext>Q</mtext></math>, is twice as far from the mirror as Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mtext>P</mtext></math>.
content.question: The image formed by the mirror has a height of magnitude <math alttext="h sub P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>h</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> when the object is at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>P</mtext></math>. If the object is moved to Point <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Q</mtext></math>, twice as far from the mirror as Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>P</mtext></math>, how does the new image height magnitude <math alttext="h sub Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>h</mi><mtext>Q</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> compare to <math alttext="h sub P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>h</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>?
